cards.name: Shuckle
cards.text: It stores Berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.

attacks.name: Hide a Berry
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards. Then, put a card from your hand on the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Burmy
cards.text: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.

cards.name: Wormadam
cards.text: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

attacks.name: Solar Ray
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leaf Cutter
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Mothim

abilities.name: Wormadam First
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Wormadam to another of your Pokémon.

cards.text: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.

cards.name: Snivy
cards.text: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Servine

abilities.name: Serpentine Strangle
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.text: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

cards.name: Serperior
cards.text: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

attacks.name: Coil
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 60 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

cards.name: Deerling
cards.text: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Moltres
cards.text: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

attacks.name: Flying Flare
attacks.text: You may do 40 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Fennekin
cards.text: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Fennekin
cards.text: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

attacks.name: Invite Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Braixen
cards.text: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

attacks.name: Destructive Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Delphox
cards.text: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degree Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psystorm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all Pokémon in play.

cards.name: Delphox BREAK

abilities.name: Flare Witch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Delphox BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

cards.name: Seel
cards.text: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of -40 degrees Fahrenheit.

cards.name: Dewgong
cards.text: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.

attacks.name: Freezing Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Omanyte
cards.text: Revived from an ancient fossil, this Pokémon uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.

cards.name: Omastar

abilities.name: Restoring Beam
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Restored Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: Once wrapped around its prey, it never lets go. It eats the prey by tearing at it with sharp fangs.

cards.name: Omastar BREAK

abilities.name: Dangerous Tentacle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-EX with his or her Active Pokémon.

cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Omastar BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

cards.name: Glaceon-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crystal Ray
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Evolution Pokémon.

cards.name: White Kyurem
cards.text: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

attacks.name: Burning Icicles
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Fire Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Binacle
cards.text: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Barbaracle

abilities.name: Hand Block
abilities.text: If you have a Stadium card in play, your opponent can't attach any Special Energy cards from his or her hand to his or her Pokémon.

cards.text: Barbaracle's legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head's orders.

cards.name: Rotom
cards.text: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

attacks.name: Energy Extract
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Plasmagic
attacks.text: Move 2 damage counters from each of your Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Alakazam-EX

abilities.name: Kinesis
abilities.text: When you play M Alakazam-EX from your hand to evolve this Pokémon, before it evolves, you may put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon and 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Suppression
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

cards.name: M Alakazam-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Zen Force
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Koffing
cards.text: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.

attacks.name: Division
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Koffing and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Weezing
cards.text: Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result in two small Koffing twins becoming conjoined as a Weezing.

attacks.name: Balloon Bomb
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard 2 cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Thick Liquid
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.name: Mew

abilities.name: Memories of Dawn
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any of your Basic Pokémon in play. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

cards.text: Its DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all Pokémon, so it can use all kinds of techniques.

attacks.name: Encounter
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Spoink
cards.text: It bounces around on its tail to keep its heart pumping. It carries a pearl from Clamperl on its head.

attacks.name: Rocket Jump
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Grumpig
cards.text: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.

attacks.name: Head Walking
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from your opponent's discard pile onto his or her Bench. Then, put 3 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Knock Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Gothita
cards.text: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something only Gothita can see.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Solosis
cards.text: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

attacks.name: Mini Link
attacks.text: If Solosis is on your Bench, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Duosion
cards.text: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.

attacks.name: Double Link
attacks.text: If Solosis is on your Bench, this attack does 30 more damage. If Duosion is on your Bench, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Reuniclus
cards.text: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

attacks.name: Link Fusion
attacks.text: If Solosis is on your Bench, this attack does 30 more damage. If Duosion is on your Bench, this attack does 60 more damage. If Reuniclus is on your Bench, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Diglett
cards.text: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.

cards.name: Marowak

abilities.name: Bodyguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks done to you or your hand by your opponent's Pokémon. Remove any existing effects.

cards.text: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Kabuto
cards.text: This Pokémon was regenerated from the fossil of an ancient creature. It protects itself with a hard shell.

cards.name: Kabutops
cards.text: A slim and fast swimmer. It slices its prey with its sharp sickles and drinks the body fluids.

attacks.name: Cling
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Larvitar
cards.text: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Larvitar
cards.text: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

attacks.name: Mountain Munch
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Pupitar
cards.text: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Regirock-EX

abilities.name: Regi Power
abilities.text: The attacks of your Fighting Pokémon (excluding Regirock-EX) do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bedrock Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Wormadam
cards.text: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

attacks.name: Twin Bursts
attacks.text: If Mothim is on your Bench, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Riolu
cards.text: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

attacks.name: Double Smash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Riolu
cards.text: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

attacks.name: Smash Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Lucario
cards.text: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.

cards.name: Hawlucha
cards.text: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.

attacks.name: Backflip
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Wicked Jab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Carbink

abilities.name: Energy Keeper
abilities.text: Basic Energy attached to your Basic Pokémon can't be discarded by effects of your opponent's attacks, Abilities, or Trainer cards.

cards.text: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Carbink

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon-EX.

cards.text: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.

cards.name: Carbink BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Carbink BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Diamond Gift
attacks.text: Attach 2 Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Fighting Pokémon.

cards.name: Zygarde
cards.text: It's hypothesized that it's monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.

attacks.name: Lookout
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aura Break
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Darkness or Fairy Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Zygarde
cards.text: It's hypothesized that it's monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Geostrike
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Zygarde-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Land's Pulse
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Cell Storm
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Zygarde-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Umbreon-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Veil of Darkness
attacks.text: Discard as many cards as you like from your hand. Then, draw that many cards.

attacks.name: Endgame
attacks.text: If your opponent's Mega Evolution Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 2 more Prize cards.

cards.name: Tyranitar

abilities.name: Raging Roar
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may attach 1 Darkness Energy from your discard pile to this Pokémon for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cards.text: If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries rivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.

attacks.name: Dark Mountain
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck. This attack does 50 more damage for each Supporter card discarded in this way.

cards.name: Vullaby
cards.text: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Mandibuzz
cards.text: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.

attacks.name: Bone Drop
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has an Ability. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Wormadam
cards.text: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

attacks.name: Strike Back
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Bronzor
cards.text: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Bronzong

abilities.name: Metal Fortress
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, including damage, done to your Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Bronzong BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Bronzong BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Metal Rain
attacks.text: Discard as many Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon as you like. For each Energy card discarded in this way, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and do 30 damage to it. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance. (You may choose the same Pokémon more than once.)

cards.name: Lucario
cards.text: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.

attacks.name: Vacuum Wave
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Fight Alone
attacks.text: If you have fewer Pokémon in play than your opponent, this attack does 60 more damage for each Pokémon fewer you have in play.

cards.name: Genesect-EX

abilities.name: Drive Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put a Pokémon Tool card attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rapid Blaster
attacks.text: Discard as many Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon as you like. This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

cards.name: Jigglypuff
cards.text: If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.

cards.name: Wigglytuff
cards.text: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Mr. Mime
cards.text: It is adept at conning people. It is said to be able to create walls out of thin air by miming.

attacks.name: Mimic
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Juggling
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Snubbull
cards.text: Small Pokémon flee from its scary face. It is, however, considered by women to be cute.

attacks.name: Ruckus
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: M Altaria-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mist Purge
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage and heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Cottonee
cards.text: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.

cards.name: Whimsicott
cards.text: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.

attacks.name: Light Steps
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Diancie-EX

abilities.name: Sparkle Veil
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wonder Stage
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Kingdra-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Big Storm
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

attacks.name: Dragon Trail
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each basic Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Meowth
cards.text: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

attacks.name: Turmoil Strike
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Kangaskhan
cards.text: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.

cards.name: Aerodactyl
cards.text: This vicious Pokémon is said to have flown in ancient skies while shrieking high-pitched cries.

attacks.name: Jet Draft
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Snorlax
cards.text: Its stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.

attacks.name: Toss and Turn
attacks.text: This attack can be used even if this Pokémon is Asleep. If it is, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Swallow
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Lugia

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, any damage done by attacks from your opponent's Active Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

attacks.name: Intensifying Burn
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Lugia BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Lugia BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Flash of Destruction
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Whismur
cards.text: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

cards.name: Loudred
cards.text: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.

cards.name: Exploud
cards.text: Its roar in battle shakes the ground like a tremor–or like an earthquake has struck.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.text: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.

cards.name: Altaria Spirit Link
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Altaria-EX.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Audino Spirit Link
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Audino-EX.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Bent Spoon
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to the Pokémon this card is attached to. (Existing effects are not removed.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Chaos Tower
cards.text: Choose which way this card faces before you play it. This ↓ player's Pokémon can't be Confused or Poisoned. (If those Pokémon are already Confused or Poisoned, remove those Special Conditions.),Choose which way this card faces before you play it. This ↓ player's Pokémon can't be Asleep or Paralyzed. (If those Pokémon are already Asleep or Paralyzed, remove those Special Conditions.),This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Devolution Spray
cards.text: Devolve 1 of your evolved Pokémon and put the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your hand. (That Pokémon can't evolve this turn.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Dome Fossil Kabuto
cards.text: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Kabuto you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Energy Pouch
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put all basic Energy attached to that Pokémon into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Energy Reset
cards.text: Put as many Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Fairy Drop
cards.text: Heal 50 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Fairy Energy attached to it.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Fairy Garden
cards.text: Each Pokémon that has any Fairy Energy attached to it (both yours and your opponent's) has no Retreat Cost.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Fossil Excavation Kit
cards.text: Put 2 in any combination of Helix Fossil Omanyte, Dome Fossil Kabuto, or Old Amber Aerodactyl cards from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Helix Fossil Omanyte
cards.text: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal an Omanyte you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Lass's Special
cards.text: Draw a card for each of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Mega Catcher
cards.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Mega Evolution Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: N
cards.text: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, each player draws a card for each of his or her remaining Prize cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: N
cards.text: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, each player draws a card for each of his or her remaining Prize cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Old Amber Aerodactyl
cards.text: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal an Aerodactyl you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Pokémon Fan Club
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Power Memory
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Zygarde-EX this card is attached to can also use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: All Cells Burn
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Random Receiver
cards.text: Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal a Supporter card. Put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Scorched Earth
cards.text: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a Fire or Fighting Energy card from his or her hand. If that player does so, he or she draws 2 cards.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Shauna
cards.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 5 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Shauna
cards.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 5 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Team Rocket's Handiwork
cards.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard 2 cards from the top of your opponent's deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Ultra Ball
cards.text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Double Colorless Energy
cards.text: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

cards.name: Strong Energy
cards.text: This card can only be attached to Fighting Pokémon. This card provides Fighting Energy only while this card is attached to a Fighting Pokémon.,The attacks of the Fighting Pokémon this card is attached to do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,(If this card is attached to anything other than a Fighting Pokémon, discard this card.)

cards.name: Glaceon-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crystal Ray
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Evolution Pokémon.

cards.name: Alakazam-EX

abilities.name: Kinesis
abilities.text: When you play M Alakazam-EX from your hand to evolve this Pokémon, before it evolves, you may put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon and 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Suppression
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.
